edu.uw.nemo.labeler

Class GraphFormat

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uw.nemo.labeler.GraphFormat

  • public class GraphFormat
extends Object
    Formats the graph into format used by nauty library for canonical labeling. Supports two formats used in nauty - graph6 and sparse6. For more information about graph formats, refer src/main/nauty/nauty25r9/formats.txt
    Author:
    vartikav

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphFormat

        @Deprecated
public GraphFormat(FormatType type,
                      List<int[]> edges,
                      int vertexCount,
                      boolean useNodeIndexer)
        Deprecated. Use other constructor with Mapping and list of vertices instead
        Construct a GraphFormat object.
        Parameters:
        type - The FormatType of the graph.
        edges - List of edges in the graph.
        vertexCount - Number of vertices in the graph.
        useNodeIndexer - Whether to use node indexer or not. When node indexer is used, the ids in list of edges are converted to indexed ids before converting to desired format.

      • GraphFormat

        public GraphFormat(FormatType type,
           Mapping mapping,
           int[] vertices)
        Construct a GraphFormat object.
        Parameters:
        type - The FormatType of the graph.
        mapping - The Mapping instance which hold adjacency list representation of the original graph. It will be used to get edges corresponding to given vertices.
        vertices - The list of vertices in the graph.

    • Method Detail

      • countDistinctGraphs

        public static Map<String,Long> countDistinctGraphs(List<Map.Entry<String,Long>> graphs)
        Counts the number of distinct graphs in the given list of graphs.
        Parameters:
        graphs - The list of graphs with their individual count.
        Returns:
        The map of distinct graphs and their aggregated count.

      • formatGraph

        public void formatGraph()
        Convert the graph into g6/s6 format, and hold it in an internal field so that it can be accessed later.
